title: Flight Engineers Give NASA’s Dragonfly Lift
summary: In sending a car-sized rotorcraft to explore Saturn’s moon Titan, NASA’s Dragonfly mission will undertake an unprecedented voyage of scientific discovery. And the work to ensure that this first-of-its-kind project can fulfill its ambitious exploration vision is underway in some of the nation’s most advanced space simulation and testing laboratories. title: L3Harris announces $845 million majority sale of Space Propulsion and Power Systems business
summary: The deal with AE Industrial Partners is expected to close in the second half of 2026. L3Harris will retain full control over the RS-25 engine.

title: Landspace secures launch contracts for China’s megaconstellation projects
summary:
Commercial launch startup Landspace has secured formal contracts to launch satellites for China’s two main megaconstellation projects, helping to address a launch capacity bottleneck.
The post Landspace secures launch contracts for China’s megaconstellation projects appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: I am Artemis: Dave Reynolds
summary: As booster manager for NASA’s SLS (Space Launch System), Dave Reynolds’ path to NASA is embodied by his childhood poster of the space shuttle’s Return to Flight initiative, which hangs in his office, serving as a constant reminder that his journey to the agency began decades ago. title: NASA chief reviews Orion heat shield, expresses “full confidence” in it for Artemis II
summary: "That level of openness and transparency is exactly what should be expected of NASA."

title: NASA’s Pandora Satellite, CubeSats to Explore Exoplanets, Beyond
summary: A new NASA spacecraft called Pandora is awaiting launch ahead of its journey to study the atmospheres of exoplanets, or worlds beyond our solar system, and their stars. Along for the ride are two shoebox-sized satellites called BlackCAT (Black Hole Coded Aperture Telescope) and SPARCS (Star-Planet Activity Research CubeSat), as NASA innovates with ambitious science […]

title: The Space Force will acquire and integrate systems faster in 2026
summary:
At the beginning of 2026, it’s worth reflecting on the U.S. Space Force’s recent accomplishments. title: Tiangong science program delivers data surge
summary:
Tokyo, Japan (SPX) Jan 09, 2026


Chinese astronauts and ground-based science teams completed 86 new scientific and technological tasks on the Tiangong space station in 2025, underscoring the outpost's expanding role in research, according to the China Manned Space Agency.

title: China tallies record launch year as lunar and asteroid plans advance
summary:
Tokyo, Japan (SPX) Jan 09, 2026


China's space sector completed 93 orbital launch missions in 2025, the highest annual total the nation has recorded.
